summary: Email chain between attorneys regarding the scheduling and preparation for an interview with David Rodgers, a witness in the Epstein investigation. The prosecutors plan to ask about a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that lists a passenger with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager.

persons.name: Brendan F. Quigley
persons.context: Attorney representing David Rodgers, corresponding with prosecutors to schedule an interview and provide flight logs.

persons.name: David Neville Rodgers
persons.context: Client of Brendan Quigley, scheduled to be interviewed by prosecutors regarding flight logs related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Andrew Lankler
persons.context: Attorney at Baker Botts copied on correspondence regarding David Rodgers' subpoena and interview.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York involved in scheduling the interview with David Rodgers.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Prosecutor copied on email regarding David Rodgers' subpoena and flight log production.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Prosecutor copied on email regarding David Rodgers' subpoena and flight log production.

connections.description: Quigley is the attorney representing Rodgers in connection with a subpoena and interview request from prosecutors.
Both are attorneys at Baker Botts working on the David Rodgers matter.
Quigley corresponds with prosecutor Alison to schedule Rodgers' interview and discuss evidence.
Rodgers is scheduled to be interviewed by prosecutor Alison regarding flight logs in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Interview of David Rodgers
events.description: Planned meeting at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza in New York for prosecutors to interview David Rodgers about flight logs related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Log Entry Investigation
events.description: Prosecutors note a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, showing a passenger with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager, which they plan to ask David Rodgers about.

events.title: Initial Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides initial set of David Rodgers' flight logs dated between January 23, 2006 and September 19, 2013 to prosecutors.

events.title: Additional Flight Log Production
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides additional flight logs for David Rodgers covering flights between 1991 and January 2006.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors plan to ask David Rodgers about a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that lists a passenger with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager who disappeared around that time.
David Rodgers is treated as a witness, not a target, in the Epstein investigation, with the interview focusing on flight records he maintained.
Flight logs for David Rodgers covering periods from 1991 to 2013 were produced to prosecutors by his attorney Brendan Quigley.
The correspondence reveals ongoing negotiations between defense and prosecution regarding the scheduling of Rodgers' interview, initially requested in July 2019.
The document shows prosecutors from the Southern District of New York actively investigating Epstein-related flight logs and possible connections to missing persons cases.
